description: Ultimately from Latin renovatus, perfect passive participle of renovō (“I renew”), either directly or as a back-formation from renovation.

verbs.description: renovate (third-person singular simple present renovates, present participle renovating, simple past and past participle renovated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To renew; to revamp something to make it look new again.
examples: This house is shabby: it needs renovating.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To restore to freshness or vigor.
